entries.title: Private Equity Puts Brakes on Healthcare Roll-Ups After Government Scrutiny
entries.description: Buyout firms in 2024 have turned away from a strategy that antitrust authorities say unfairly reduces competition.

entries.title: Weak U.S. Job Openings Data Could Send Dollar Lower
entries.description: U.S. JOLTs job openings data for April due at 1400 GMT could mark a catalyst for dollar falls over the coming weeks, ING said.

entries.title: British American Tobacco Keeps Outlook
entries.description: British American Tobacco maintained its 2024 guidance of low-single-digit organic revenue growth as it reported performance for the first half of the year in line with its expectations.

entries.title: Developers Sit on Empty Lots After Historic Apartment Boom
entries.description: Higher interest rates and flattening rents are scuttling rental projects.

entries.title: How School Shootings Are Changing the Design of American Classrooms
entries.description: Architects are focusing on safety features to keep perpetrators out and create a sense of community for students.

entries.title: The Best Athlete in America Is a Giant German
entries.description: Leo Neugebauer, an NCAA-champion decathlete at Texas, is aiming for a repeat—and Olympic gold in Paris.

entries.title: Tesla China's Sales Rose in May Amid EV Demand Recovery
entries.description: Tesla’s sales in China rose in May, as the country’s demand for electric vehicles picked up, thanks to government trade-in programs and consumer interest generated by the Beijing Auto Show.

entries.title: Live Markets: Latest on Meme Stocks
entries.description: GameStop stock rose modestly ahead of the opening bell. After Monday’s market close, a Reddit account linked to meme-king Keith Gill shared a new screenshot indicating he hadn’t budged from his position in the company.

entries.title: The Dollar Is at Its Strongest Since the 1980s. CanIt Last?
entries.description: Though the greenback is still below the recent 2022 peak, it hasn’t been so consistently strong in “real” terms since the days of Paul Volcker. Back then, developed nations had to conspire to depreciate it.

entries.title: One Family Was All In on Biden. Now They're Divided Over Gaza.
entries.description: U.S. support for Israel’s war effort and the humanitarian crisis in Gaza have added a new dimension to the presidential election.

entries.title: JGB 10-Year Yield May Top 1.1% by Year-End, UBS Says
entries.description: The Bank of Japan is likely to deliver an additional rate hike in July, along with modifications to its JGB purchases, UBS Global Wealth Management said, and forecast the 10-year JGB yield to top 1.1% by year-end but expects upside to be contained.

entries.title: Chinese Equities May Outperform Regional Peers
entries.description: China’s equities are expected to outperform their regional peers, UBS said, pointing to catalysts including the recent property rescue package, encouraging Chinese tech earnings and a muted reaction to fresh U.S. tariffs.

entries.title: India Modi Struggles to Hold On to Majority, Early Election Results Show
entries.description: The Indian prime minister and his Hindu nationalist party appeared to be set for a severe setback amid a strong fight from a revived opposition.

entries.title: Gold Futures Slip But Remain Largely Rangebound Ahead of Key Catalysts
entries.description: Gold edged lower, trading within a tight range, as non-interest yielding bullion found some support from stronger expectations of the Fed cutting interest rates later this year, as Monday’s U.S. data revealed a slowdown in manufacturing and...

entries.title: Oil Slides to Four-Month Lows as OPEC+ Move Is Seen as Bearish
entries.description: Oil prices hit a four-month low in Europe, signaling OPEC+’s policy move disappointed markets.

entries.title: Deutsche Telekom's Largest Shareholder Cuts Stake
entries.description: German state-owned bank KfW sold 110 million shares in Deutsche Telekom for $2.7 billion to free up funds for investment in Deutsche Bahn.

entries.title: India Shares Fall as Modi-Led Alliance Faces Narrower Victory Margin
entries.description: India’s key stock market indexes are sharply lower as early results from the national elections indicate the ruling coalition wouldn’t win a decisive victory as predicted by exit polls.

entries.title: U.K. Retail Sales Rebound Weakly
entries.description: Retail sales ticked higher in the U.K. in May, recovering some previous decline ahead of general elections slated for July, according to a BRC-KPMG report.

entries.title: Hitachi, Microsoft Plan for Multibillion-Dollar AI Partnership
entries.description: Hitachi and Microsoft announced a multibillion-dollar collaboration to accelerate the adoption of generative artificial intelligence, the latest in a series of partnerships and investments the two companies are undertaking.

entries.title: Why China's Overcapacity Problem Is About to Get Even Worse, in Seven Charts
entries.description: Cheap Chinese high-tech goods have flooded the global economy this year, raising alarms in Washington and Brussels.
